oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Fort Mimms
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white engraving entitled Massacre at Fort Mimms, depicting the raid against inhabitants of the fort led by Creek Chief William Weatherford in 1813. Decorative border surronds image.

The band of Creeks known as the Red Sticks attacked the fort on August 30, 1813 resulting in the deaths or capture of approximately 250 settlers, militia, slaves, and Creeks who were loyal to the Americans.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Weatherford, William, approximately 1780-1824
Fort Mims (Ala.); Creek War, 1813-1814; Violence
